messages.message:
When I use `@file_name` in a conversation query to direct the model to prioritize a specific file when answering, my message scope seems to indicate the mentioned file as an _additional_ file in the message scope. E.g. here it says the message scope is 3 files, when I’ve only uploaded 2 files total, and I’m mentioning a file already included in the scope. I think this is a byproduct of the comparison files/query documents feature in chatbots?

cc @Balaram
Similar Converse feedback, the menu of options for my chart is obscured by the chart title. I’d expect the menu to use the same design as on tables, where it’s on a white background.
Thanks for the feedback! I will create a ticket to track this
